headline: What $6,500 a Month Really Looks Like in Retirement at 67
summary: Retiring at 67 with $6,500 in monthly income places you solidly in middle-class territory, but the financial reality behind that figure is more nuanced than it appears. With average Social Security benefits at $2,017 per month in 2026, a retiree targeting $6,500 needs to generate roughly $4,483 monthly—or $53,796 annually—from personal savings and investments. The ... What $6,500 a Month Really Looks Like in Retirement at 67

headline: PepsiCo's PFNA Struggles: Can Permissible Snacks Revive Volumes?
summary: PEP is leaning on permissible snack brands to counter uneven PFNA volumes as value sensitivity and shifting preferences pressure core snacks.

headline: The Bullish Technical Case for Consumer Staples Stocks in 2026
summary: This type of price action reflects strong buying pressure, likely institutional participation, and resulted in a bullish candlestick.  Each occurrence marked a point of support and was followed by a bullish candlestick formation.  In June 2018, a bullish morning star pattern launched a six-month winning streak.

headline: Coca-Cola's Innovation Pipeline: Catalyst for Volume Acceleration?
summary: KO leans on product, digital and sustainability innovation as volumes soften, betting zero-sugar, hydration and RTD coffee to steady growth.

headline: Coca-Cola Brings the Iconic FIFA World Cup™ Trophy to India After 12 Years
summary: The original FIFA World Cup™ Trophy has arrived in India as part of the FIFA World Cup™ Trophy Tour by Coca-Cola. This marks its return to India after twelve years, ahead of the FIFA World Cup 2026™. As the exclusive partner of the Trophy Tour, Coca–Cola continues its long-standing association with football by bringing one of the world's most iconic sporting symbols closer to Indian fans.
